sponsor.partnerMessage: Beth Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy weekend all! Here are some events you might enjoy over the next few days:

  • Celebrate Earth: Crystal Bridges is hosting its Earth Day celebration this evening with live music, art-making, and more! Admission is free. 
  • Tunes: There is a variety of live music offered this weekend including Garth Brooks at Razorback Stadium.
  • Food & fame: The Momentary is hosting the world-famous Turkey and the Wolf restaurant tomorrow until they are sold out in the Arvest Bank Courtyard.
  • Pro Cup: Spend your weekend watching MTB racing at Centennial Park in Fayetteville as the US Pro Cup visits NWA.
  • Community celebration: Experience Bentonville Together happening on the Bentonville Square this Saturday from 4-9p.
  • Chainsaws: Over the weekend, Eureka Springs is hosting Carving in the Ozarks, a chainsaw carving festival free to the public.
  • Happy Birthday! Fox Trail Distillery is celebrating its 3rd Birthday today with tacos, cookie cake, and free tours of the distillery!
  • The outdoors: Join the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks this Sunday for its Earth Day celebration with fun crafts and games for the whole family to enjoy.

See you Monday!

posts.title: New Crumbl Cookies Opens in Rogers and Eyes Fayetteville
posts.content:
The moment some of you Rogers residents have been waiting for has arrived! A new Crumbl Cookies has opened its doors in Rogers and is baking some of the freshest cookies for you to enjoy!

  • Cookie selection: The new location is opening up this month off S Pleasant Crossing Blvd in Rogers and according to the Fayetteville Flyer, Fayetteville will receive a franchise shortly thereafter. Crumbl is known for changing its menu every week to feature six different cookies for customers to try.
  • History snippet: Crumbl Cookies started in 2017 in Utah and now there are over 300 bakeries around the country, making it the fastest-growing cookie company in the nation. The family-owned business has a mission to bring families and friends together over the world’s best pink box of cookies. 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Plug and Play Expo Coming To Bentonville
posts.content:
Plug and Play Northwest Arkansas announced they will be hosting a supply chain expo this coming Tuesday, April 26, from 1-6p at the Record in Bentonville. 

  • What: The event will feature 20 alumni startups in the supply chain and logistics arena and highlight achievements of their corporate partners. The Walmart US President and CEO will serve as the keynote speaker, and other top industry executives and experts will speak on the future of supply chain and logistics. 
  • Who: Plug and Play is a global innovation platform that connects corporations with startups. The company has worked with over 30,000 startups and has over 500 official corporate partners. Companies in the Plug and Play community have raised over $9 billion in funding, and some successful portfolio exits include Danger, Dropbox, Lending Club, and PayPal. 

Learn more and register for the expo HERE.

posts.title: Outpost In Rogers Acquires Electric Vehicles For Sale And Rent
posts.content:
There’s an exciting new line of electric vehicles at 2nd Street Outpost and Outfitters in Rogers. 

  • Electric rides: 2nd Street Outpost and Outfitters recently announced its order of boom!MOTO 100% electric eBicycles, eMotorcycles, eScooters, and an ATV that marks the beginning of a new approachable and sustainable way for anyone to see Northwest Arkansas via trails. 
  • Seeing the sites: The Outpost in Rogers has a rental program in the works that will allow customers to experience bikes without making a purchase. The retailer realizes that not everyone is able to hop on a traditional bike, so they created a solution that encourages people to experience the attractions of Downtown Rogers.

For more details, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Prestigious award: A U of A Geoscience professor was awarded an international grant by The Explorers Club and Discovery Channel. 
  • Top tier: Arkansas Basketball just locked in its highest ranked class in program history.
  • Speakers: Prairie Street Live in Fayetteville has one extra hour of live music on Thursdays. 
  • Storm damage: Disaster assistance is available through the State of Arkansas Individual Assistance program. 
  • Trees: The Arkansas Department of Agriculture is sponsoring Free Tree Fridays today in Fayetteville at Wilson Park from 11a to 2p. 
  • Get in here: Let us know about your organization's initiative or event, and we'll see about putting it in our newsletter. Check out our advertising deals HERE.
